TopicTitle: Rate my Mün landing cargo SSTO!

Articles.Content:
My original plan was to create a cargo SSTO that could carry 4 large Mk2 bays worth of cargo, land at Mün, and return to Kerbin.

This turned out to be a much bigger challenge than I though it would be!
As the plane got bigger, it needed more engines, more fuel, then it couldn't land anymore, so needed more engines, more fuel, etc.

So I tried going simpler with only 2 large Mk2 bays. Still took quite a bit of trial and error, but I finally did it.
As a craft, it's a delicate balance of size, mass, fuel, cargo, and power.

76 tons, 3.5k - 4k ∆v after reaching LKO.

How did I do?

 

Edited August 8, 2017 by Tychonoir
Is there some reason you didn't just use a mk3?
I don't particularly care for the Mk3 parts, and the appropriate engines are the wrong scale.
But Mk3 is so much more convenient for cargo. Also, there is a thing called an adapter. Useful for making like Mk3 parts work better with 1.25m engines. Or you could use radial attachment.

No, wrong scale as in wrong thrust scale. You end up needing dozens of engines. Which is very Kerbal, but a bit annoying. I'm already using 6 engines, and this is <100 tons.
And it's not just the engines, but the wings and plenty of other stuff.

But I'm not trying to turn this into a Mk3 bashing thread.
Not bad. Could do better I suppose. Most of my craft are either re-usable rockets or failed creative spaceplanes.
